intro: Gilia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Mirielleaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the flowers are often found in clusters at the ends of the stems. Gilia ciliata is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
